meanings.definition: A Jewish prayer book used during the High Holy Days.
meanings.sent1: During Rosh Hashanah, the rabbi read from the machzor to guide the congregation in prayer.
meanings.sent2: The machzor contains special prayers for Yom Kippur, the holiest day in the Jewish calendar.
meanings.sent3: Sarah accidentally dropped the machzor, causing a flurry of bookmarks to scatter around the synagogue.
meanings.sent4: The machzor is like a spiritual compass, leading us through the sacred journey of the High Holy Days.
meanings.sent5: As the cantor opened the machzor, the ancient words seemed to come alive, filling the room with reverence.

meanings.definition: A cycle of prayers and readings for the Jewish year.
meanings.sent1: The machzor guides us through the annual cycle of Jewish holidays and observances.
meanings.sent2: Families gather together to recite prayers from the machzor during Passover and other significant occasions.
meanings.sent3: David joked that his machzor must have a mind of its own, always opening to the same page each year.
meanings.sent4: In the rhythm of the machzor, we find comfort and connection to our heritage.
meanings.sent5: The melodies sung during the machzor resonate with the changing seasons, echoing the passage of time.
